content: During the first quarter of 2022, the company generated revenues of $164 million and consolidated EBITDA of $14.5 million, representing sequential increases of 2% and 8% respectively, driven by the improved commodity price environment, driving strong activity in the United States, along with a favorable sales mix in our Offshore/Manufactured Products segment. In our Downhole Technologies segment, we reported revenues of $32 million and segment EBITDA of $2.9 million in the first quarter of 2022 compared to revenues of $26 million and adjusted segment EBITDA of $100,000 reported in the fourth quarter of 2021, driven by higher demand internationally for our perforating products along with improved US sales of our completion products, including frac plugs and toe valves.
